item.title: Snake
item.description: This is a snake clone that I made in Unreal Engine 5 to improve my knowledge of the engine. I uploaded a small gameplay video here. Main features: Grass rendering + grass blades bending Niagara: Snake body -> ribbon Grass bending direction Enhanced input Savegame system for tracking player record. Materials: Grass checkerboard pattern and fake AO Snake body color In addition I added some visual debugging features, like snake body box colliders and tile occupancy to help me during development.

item.title: EngineGL
item.description: This is a toy renderer written in C++ and OpenGL to learn new graphics techniques and C++. The renderer features at the moment: Forward rendering Spot and directional lights support Shadowmapping Soft edge shadows Shadow support for multiple lights Environment mapping + simple environment reflections. Soft shadows To add soft shadows I implemented the technique described in GPU Gems 2 ch. 17. Basically it adds some noise to offset the sample points for the PCF technique.

item.title: Ray Marched scene
item.description: This is a basic shader created in Shadertoy to learn and explore ray marching. In this project, I implemented the following features: Signed distance field to render spheres and a plane. A simple Blinn-Phong lighting model with a directional light. Shadows achieved by ray marching towards the light source.
